data.title: Business Overview
data.description: Breadlife is Indonesia's leading Japanese-inspired artisan bakery chain, owned by The Daily Company (DailyCo). Known for its fresh, preservative-free breads, Breadlife operates over 130 outlets in major cities and transit hubs, serving both B2C retail and institutional B2B clients.
highlights: Largest Japanese-style artisan bakery network in Indonesia
Rapid expansion with 100+ new outlets since 2021 acquisition
Consistent double-digit revenue and EBITDA growth post-acquisition
services: Packaged soft buns and B2B snack boxes
data.positioning_desc: Premium yet affordable, health-forward bakery catering to urban consumers seeking fresh, innovative, and quality baked goods.

data.title: Investor Considerations
considerations: Intensifying competition in Indonesia's bakery sector from local and international players
Managing supply chain and input cost volatility (wheat, dairy)
Sustaining growth momentum post rapid expansion phase
Ability to maintain product innovation and consumer engagement
mitigants: Strong brand loyalty and high repeat purchase rates
Centralized procurement and long-term supplier contracts
Proven track record of outlet-level profitability and disciplined expansion
Continuous menu innovation driven by in-house R&D team

services.title: Artisan Sweet Breads
services.desc: Wide range of Japanese-inspired sweet breads with signature fillings, baked fresh daily.

services.title: Savory Breads & Snacks
services.desc: Popular choices include Yakitari, spicy chicken floss buns, and cheese breads catering to diverse tastes.

services.title: Cakes & Celebration Products
services.desc: Whole cakes, chiffon cakes, and party cakes for birthdays and gifting occasions.

services.title: Packaged Soft Buns & Bundles
services.desc: Multi-pack soft buns and convenient snack boxes for families, groups, and B2B clients.

revenue_growth.description: Breadlife achieved a 150% revenue increase from 2022 to 2024, outpacing Indonesia's bakery market CAGR and demonstrating strong post-acquisition momentum.

banker_view.summary: Breadlife's financial trajectory reflects robust operational leverage and scalability, with margin expansion driven by central production and disciplined outlet growth.

valuation_data.commentary: Based on 1.0x–1.2x forward revenue and 8–9x EBITDA multiples for Indonesian bakery transactions
Implied by 1.2x revenue and 9.5x EBITDA, in line with Sari Roti (IDX:ROTI) trading multiples
Assumes 12% discount rate, 5% terminal growth, and continued EBITDA margin expansion
